website_summaries.verdict: If you crave a compact megazoom that gives you a lot of control over your results, look no further than the Fujifilm FinePix F900EXR.
pros: The Fujifilm FinePix F900EXR has hobbyist-targeted features like manual controls, direct access to settings, and raw capture
Shooting performance and picture quality are excellent
cons: For those unfamiliar with Fujifilm's EXR sensors, getting the best results can require a little extra effort
Similarly, its menus and controls can take some adjustment

customer_reviews.title: Great device if you have a memory like a steel trap
customer_reviews.text: If the menu and options buttons made more sense it would be overwhelmingly fantastic. Quality of images is very good, but remembering where each setting is located in the "unending" menus and various knob positions makes high quality, impromptu photos difficult. Always focused, but aperture/shutter/effects get wonky without tweaking settings. If you have the time to memorize all the settings locations, this camera rocks. Casual, posed photos or still life/landscape ones come out spectacularly. Takes amazing sunset and cloudy sky photos. The shafts of light are well defined and make your shots look professional.
customer_reviews.author: GDKay

customer_reviews.title: 14 Months of Use and the camera is unusable.  Estimate to repair is $160.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to use in my construction and consulting business. It allows me to really zoom in to pick up the details on an installed piece of equipment to be able to see how it is mounted and installed. I can even pick off mfgrs part numbers without needing a ladder or manlift. The photos are acceptable but maybe not good enough for marketing brochures. That might also be due to my complete lack of ability. I use it in automatic mode so maybe there is a way to use the manual settings and get better results. EDIT: 4/18/2015 _ Camera started giving "Lens Control Error" and is unusable. Warranty expired last month. $250 for a years use.
customer_reviews.author: Stu T

customer_reviews.title: A powerful little camera
customer_reviews.text: I had tried several other small zoom cameras before this one, but none of them produced the high quality imagery that this one does. I'm a semi-pro who mostly shoots RAW (which this camera does), but occasionally I need quick shots that don't need post-processing. The Fujifilm EXR900 delivers. The noise reduction is well handled with little smearing up to ISO 800. I can shoot highly usable raw shots at much higher ISOs. I find the handling of this camera much better than the really tiny ones. There's a nice front grip. The menu is easy to navigate, too.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we need!
customer_reviews.text: With grandbabies and grand kids, my DSLR was feeling cumbersome. No one wants to lug a big camera backpack, water bottles, folding chairs, blankets, and a picnic along to those pee wee football games, or around the maternity unit of the local hospital. This camera gives me the flexibility to have some control over my shots combined with the portability appropriate for everyday situations. Only drawback - there is no viewfinder, only a screen. It's a commodious screen to be sure, but in full sun it's pretty useless. Knocks off a star, even.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Morgan-Oakes

customer_reviews.title: Easy for the amateur; reliable and logical menus; good on-camera software
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps a bit pricey for the amateur, but nice features, easy for the amateur / reliable menus and on-camera software (trust me, some other cameras have great hardware specs, but fail on this). Has a few features that pros will appreciate for quick snaps, too. I have enjoyed tagging along with this camera with my wife while she does the real photography with her real professional equipment and have been able to come up with some nice prize-winning results of my own, thank you very much! : )
customer_reviews.author: J. Bullock

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: We haven't purchased a point and shoot camera in a number of years. After reading the reviews we selected the Fuji F900EXR. Must say it meets all out expectations. Great pictures, zoom is excellent, even the wireless transfer worked. We were skeptical that the wireless would work after reading all the negative reviews, but we had no problem setting it up on our smart phones and PC. Now we are not camera geeks and don't expect this point and shoot to take as good of pictures as our SLR, but for the price this is a great pocket camera.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph and Linda C

customer_reviews.title: Junk - Lens Fails - Do NOT buy.
customer_reviews.text: By far the costliest mistake I've made on Amazon. Purchased in May 2014, this camera promptly failed 100% upon taking one photograph the 1st day of our trip to Paris, France in December 2014. I cannot return it, and it is out of warrantee. Fuji is very familiar with the "lens stuck open" problem and will offer to fix it for $80 to $130. A failure message appears "TURN OFF THE CAMERA AND TURN ON AGAIN" - over and over, regardless of replacing the battery or memory card. This camera will likely fail you too. In essence, I rented it for $30 per month. I am furious.
customer_reviews.author: eric4322

customer_reviews.title: BEST FOR THE MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I traded my Fuji FinePix F100fd for this camera. The 20x zoon is twice old one and steadier. The individual settings, other than "auto" ar laid out better. The movie setting can be zoomed, which the old one didn't. Overall, fot about the same size, it does more better. I am just a point and click type. It will take me a while to master all the features this camera offers. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: E. A. Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Almost everything about this camera is great. With Macro
customer_reviews.text: Almost everything about this camera is great. With Macro, I look into the flower like a lilly, and what's deep in the flower is focused great. Photos in regular focus are also great. The thing I HATE is my trying to remember to let the flash up. It's not automatic. But, it's obvious when you take the picture. But forgetting to release the flash and get the photo at that right time can make you speak to yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Ole45mag

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: I am somewhat disappointed in the quality. The images are not always sharp. The video constantly changes focus, no matter if the object is moving or stationary. The only good pictures I got were from really close range, like 3-5 feet. I was trying to make a portrait and it came out as DSLR quality, which was very surprising, considering that it was dark and I used flash. The shots outside in a sunny weather are good, but inside if you're shooting a party - just satisfactory. You need to be really close to the object to make a good picture.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: A complete package
customer_reviews.text: These point and shoot cameras are hard to beat. With a good assortment of shooting modes you can get some excellent pictures. This camera has wi-fi capabilities but if you don't want that you can save some money and get eeverything else in the F850.
customer_reviews.author: KSArnold

customer_reviews.title: almost fully auto most important
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for the wife who wanted a really good point and shoot, and video. directions easy to read. she likes it a lot and that's about all that matters. although I'm not the primary user of the product, it appears to have about 100 more features than she needed, but purchased based on reviews here and at Consumer Reports for quality of pix and video.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeJ

customer_reviews.title: great little point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: No complaints as this camera has exceeded our expectations. Great lens and optical zoom. Great automatic modes. More ability than most point and shoots for manual adjustments. Please remember that no cameras of this type focus fast enough for shooting multiple, rapid action sport shots. But the focus on this camera is faster than most of its type and better than I expected. GPS and WiFi work perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: sfo 2  fco

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Was considering other compact size cameras and after having looked at reviews on CNET.com I chose this one based on its features and the great price through Amazon. Have had it for a day and I have been snapping all kinds of pictures. Very fast capture and the screen is super clear! Definitely a must buy and something great for travels.
customer_reviews.author: A W

customer_reviews.title: Fujifilm Finepix F900EXR is Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice small camera that fit in your pocket. With the Auto EXR mode it take Great pictures that are really sharp, this will shot in the RAW that is very good picture qualities. If you go on YouTube and search for Fuji guys f900EXR these guys are good. They sold me.
customer_reviews.author: Roco

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, takes great pictures and is pretty easy to use with a little time spent exploring the different options. It would have been 5 stars if the wifi worked, mine didn't. It's not a huge big deal though. It's not overtasking to plug the thing in to transfer photos. Overall, happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The picture quality is excellent, and the zoom is amazing. I works well in low lighting, but it could have been perfect if it had a viewfinder and geo labeling capability. The LCD screen, as is the case with all the other cameras I had, is difficult to see in sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: AOGoedde

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera. Bought this to replace the same model which had dropped out of my bag into the driveway and met a sad end....I will admit it doesn't stand up to being driven over. I get great pictures with this camera and there's enough settings to let me experiment and be artistic. Note that this camera came to me with its manual in Japanese but it's avaliable in English online.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera
customer_reviews.text: First point & Shoot I have bought in several years. Bought for a trip on which I don't want to carry anything in my hands. This one fits the bill. Shooting options are numerous and this little camera will please the most discriminating snapshot taker. The documentation has some short falls and is slightly confusing in spots and registering the camera online is an experience in itself. If Fuji would take the time to get their web site and documentation up to par with their camera it would be wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: C. Price

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Great DSLR Replacement
customer_reviews.text: We travel and when our DSL broke beyond feasible repair, we selected this Fuji, one of several "bridge" digital cameras. With most of the functionality and flexibility of a DSL, this small, easy to operate camera is taking amazing photos of birds in our lakeside backyard, our grandkids, and our travels.
customer_reviews.author: TexasBebe

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: This camera is awesome! So easy to use, fits in your pocket, takes awesome photos! Purchase extra chargers and batteries, especially if you'll use it in cold weather; cold eats batteries for snacks.
customer_reviews.author: PJDSR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: We find FinePix cameras to have exceptional value and all the advanced features you would expect to be found in more costly cameras. Speed and resolution are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Edward W Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Much improved over previous camera...
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an earlier travel-sized Fujifilm FinePix. With this camera, I probably skipped a couple of iterations of improvements. The new camera has many improvements, which I like ...in particular, special shooting modes, depending on lighting and desired effect. Plus the images contain more data, and withstand enlarging better than the previous camera's images.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald G. Sherwin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Camera
customer_reviews.text: Love love love my camera, Takes great pictures and is better than any camera I have ever used as a point and shoot. I would not have any other camera. Way worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Kelly J. Kocher

customer_reviews.title: Super camera for travel
customer_reviews.text: Love it totally. Almost fits the bill for all pics for me. Fits perfectly in the purse. Fuji knows how to make a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: K Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for my wife as a Christmas gift. It has amazing picture and video quality! She loves it and can't stop taking pictures with it! Definitely would buy another one in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: great little point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: lots of ways to customize your photos - full array of settings pictures are great in full light, ok in low light small and lightweight wireless download does not work well
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Hackley

customer_reviews.title: Nice bang for buck, with minor concessions
customer_reviews.text: Good product, I wish it came with an English manual but the quick solution was to just download the manual online. It could also be a little more user friendly with a touch screen
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCafferty

customer_reviews.title: picture quality was very poor though. jpegs looked barely OK when viewed on ...
customer_reviews.text: such lovely camera. well built and with all features that one would need. picture quality was very poor though. jpegs looked barely OK when viewed on a computer and when viewed at 100% they were all blotches and totally unacceptable. i tried both auto mode and manual mode, all different iso's. very sorry it did not work for me pic quality wise cause otherwise it was almost superb.
customer_reviews.author: milosmaj

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great point-and-shoot camera for taking almost instantaneous pictures. The colors are great, and the pictures we take are sometimes better than what we can see in real life.
customer_reviews.author: algauthor

customer_reviews.title: doing pretty good. I haven't figured out the settings for ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, doing pretty good. I haven't figured out the settings for low light/dusk, but overall this camera has good quality. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera BUT
customer_reviews.text: The product is great, but only being able to access instructions online is a bit daunting. Espeacially when you have a question and are no where near a internet. An instruction booklet should be offered!!!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: took the camera on vacation 1 week after receiving. It did everything I expected. The photos look great. However, I am still learning. Will have this camera for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, weak battery
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera. Superb pictures- sharp and brilliant/accurate color rendition, intuitive to use. Very good low-light pictures without the flash. Only negatives, weak flash and the battery is not holding a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L Levine

customer_reviews.title: Good camera and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I chose this camera to do real estate property shots, and it does that well. Good exposure and the flash is adequate. Battery sure does run down quickly though. Glad I bought the backup battery package.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: camera review
customer_reviews.text: Bought the camera for my wife and she loves the zoom and how nice the pictures look. The camera also does well when the subject is moving.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Goss

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME concert pix!
customer_reviews.text: Pix taken in a low-light concert turned out FANTASTIC, especially at tight zoom! VERY impressed, for the money I spent!
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: So far this camera has been solid. I really like all the features it offers. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars is a couple of times I have had issues with it not focusing and the WiFi upload feature is a pain. I still haven't been able to transfer pictures from the camera to my computer.
customer_reviews.author: tchinds

customer_reviews.title: Fujifilm finepix F900 exr cmos camera indigo blue
customer_reviews.text: I had many hours into my search for another camera. This is my first fuji camera. I want everyone to know that this camera is small enough to really be a shirt pocket camera. I've only had it for a week and as such still learning about it. I had downloaded the manual from fuji before the camera was even shipped. It is very lightweight. I'm still looking for a camera with more features. I recomend this camera. Thanks, Randy H.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures, clunky user experience.
customer_reviews.text: Takes solid pictures with good color. Interface is so-so. Don't care for the type of flash or the fact that you have to remember to manually pop the flash up before shooting. Very odd. Battery life is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Homes Cool

customer_reviews.title: No English manual
customer_reviews.text: Camera is nice, but hard to figure out all options as the only manual supplied is in Japanese. This would have been helpful to know this before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Utah1

customer_reviews.title: Crystal Clear
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera and it has a lot of extra stuff on it. I dont even have a clue how to properly use it all, so I stick with the auto feature. The pictures this camera takes are eye watering. Crisp shots and does well in low light also. I couldn't be more happy. The wireless upload works great too.
customer_reviews.author: Slayer Doc Woo

customer_reviews.title: I can"t read Japanese
customer_reviews.text: Camera was compact, cute, and priced right. Only one problem: owners manual and camera menu were in Japanese rendering camera virtually useless to me---English speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned...not so great
customer_reviews.text: Auto Focusing not so great and EXR mode even worst. Took nearly 100 pictures of my 1 year old and over 90% turned out blurry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I was not going to purchase another fuji...but I did. It has a terrific zoom and the quality is very good. I have only used it about 6 times.
customer_reviews.author: alexandria

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: why in the hell cant americans make anything anymore...... got this for my wife and when we received it and opened it she was loving it until she pulled out the owners manual and woopeeeeeeeee , It is written in chicken s*** china language......and the dam camera is made in china and it was supposed to be made in japan.... I call that false advertising where I come from.....And when she calls to get a return mailing label It cant be downloaded.....So there you have it.... 300 American hard earned dollars for a cheap piece of china junk...... And we wonder why our country has gone to hell...... It is Sad
customer_reviews.author: Mike Eversole

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera. Great size and features for a P&S
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera. Great size and features for a P&S. A good option when I don't want to lug the DSLR around.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer NCC-1701

product_meta.title: Fujifilm FinePix F900EXR 16MP Digital Camera with 3-Inch LCD (Black) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description: Color:BlackFinePix F900EXR is the perfect travel companion for the photo enthusiast. Large 16MP EXR CMOS 1/2" Sensor with phase detection pixels and new EXR processor for outstanding low light, HD movie and continuous shooting and AF performance. Travel light but sacrifice range with Fujifilm's high quality Fujinon 20x Optical zoom (25-500mm) with image stabilization and 40x Intelligent Digital Zoom. Full HD movies with dedicated movie button. High Speed continuous shooting 9fps at full resolution. Wi-Fi certified so you can easily share images from just about anywhere - Smart Phone/Tablet or PC. RAW support. Get creative with 6 new artistic filters.
feature_bullets: 16MP EXR CMOS 1/2" Sensor with Phase Detection

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars95 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
